name: Dividing by 10,100 and 1000 by moving the decimal point

skills.name: Dividing by 10,100 and 1000 by moving the decimal point

explanations.A: You've multiplied by 10. To divide by 10, we move the decimal point one place to the left. Remember that dividing by 10 will make the answer smaller than 1.3.
explanations.B: To divide by 10, we move the decimal point one place to the left. Therefore, 1.3 ÷ 10 = 0.13
explanations.C: You've put a zero in the middle of the number, but this isn't how we divide by 10. To divide by 10, we move the decimal point one place to the left.
explanations.D: You've put a zero at the start of the number, but this isn't how we divide by 10. To divide by 10, we move the decimal point one place to the left.

explanations.A: If we divided by 10, the decimal point would move one place to the left. But the decimal point has moved two places to the left.
explanations.B: The decimal point has moved two places to the left. Therefore, 10.3 has been divided by 100.
explanations.C: If we divided by 1000, the decimal point would move three places to the left. But the decimal point has moved two places to the left.
explanations.D: If we divided by 1, the number would stay exactly the same. But the decimal point has moved two places to the left.
